intro: Buglossum caeruleum, commonly known as blue bugloss, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Buglossum caeruleum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
